body: Watch a live stream of the panel debate from 12pm BST on Thursday 26 May    Continue is a new annual conference from the National Videogame Arcade, supported by Arts Council England, about exploring the role of video games in contemporary culture. A mix of presentations, case studies and hands-on playing, the event aims to set the agenda for games and culture over two days.   Related: Videogames are a remarkable artform that can help save UK culture    As a media partner for the event, we will be hosting a panel discussion about the untapped value of video games to the cultural establishment – and not only financially.  The discussion will be streamed live via Twitch (embedded below) from 12pm BST on Thursday 26 May. The panel features: • Ian Livingstone, author and entrepreneur• Sarah Brin, writer and curator• Sir Peter Bazalgette, chair, Arts Council England• Martha Henson, digital producer and consultant, Frankly Green and Webb• Iain Dodgeon, broadcast, games and film manager, Wellcome Trust• Kristy Diaz, digital producer, Threshold Studios• Simon Parkin (chair), writer and journalist We’re also inviting you to submit questions for the discussion. Email continue@gamecity.org with your thoughts, comments and questions for the panel. Miss the live stream?
